title: 113_s1268
content: SECTION 1. APPROVAL OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU. Definitions: The term "Agreement" refers to the Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010. The term "Compact of Free Association" refers to the Compact of Free Association between the Government of the United States of America and the Government of Palau. Results of Compact Review: Title I of Public Law 99-658 is amended to include a section on the results of the Compact review. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau signed in 2010 is approved, with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011-2013, payments under the Agreement will be withheld until the trust fund is reimbursed. The Republic of Palau must reimburse the trust fund for amounts exceeding $5,000,000 in fiscal years. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer necessary funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing specific sections of the Agreement. Appropriations are authorized for subsidizing postal services to Palau, the Marshall Islands, and Micronesia. The Compact of Free Association allows Federal entities to carry out their responsibilities by providing necessary funds. Section 3 of the Act of June 30, 1954 is repealed. The Agreement includes a payment schedule and funding provisions. "Section 1 establishes the Compact Section 211(f) Fund." The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund in accordance with a schedule. Additionally, a grant of $6,912,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 will be provided for the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund. The Republic of Palau will match the contributions made by the United States. The United States will contribute $150,000 quarterly to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from 2014 to 2024. The implementation will follow the provisions of Appendix A to the Agreement. The United States will contribute $150,000 quarterly to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from 2014 to 2024, following the provisions of Appendix A to the Agreement. Additionally, there is a Fiscal Consolidation Fund established. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears. Economic assistance to Palau will amount to $69,250,000 over several fiscal years, starting from 2014. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with economic assistance totaling $28,250,000 over fiscal years 2018 to 2023. The funds will be distributed in quarterly payments as specified in the Agreement. Additionally, infrastructure projects will be addressed in Section 5 of the Agreement. The United States will provide Palau with $40,000,000 in grants for infrastructure projects over several fiscal years. Additionally, there is an amendment to extend a program until 2024 and a clarification on passport requirements. Nonimmigrants in the United States and its territories can be admitted without certain passport requirements if they fall into specific categories, including citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands who are now citizens of Palau, those who acquire Palau citizenship at birth, and naturalized citizens who have been residents for at least five years. Nonimmigrants in the United States and its territories, including citizens of Palau, can accept employment with permission from the Secretary of Homeland Security. They may establish habitual residence in the US, subject to non-discriminatory limitations. However, they do not have the right to establish residence for naturalization under the Immigration and Nationality Act.
